Service Information

Free, fast, and friendly

service.html
  • Intervals

    A Shuttle Every 15–25 minutes!

    Shuttles on the Orange, Pruple, and Green Route have a 15–20 minute interval.

    The Banner route has a shuttle en route every 20–25 minutes: Please note that there is a 45 minute headway between 11:00am to 3:00pm for the Banner route.

    15–20 min 20–25 min
  • Hours

    9am to 8pm Everyday, Year Round.

    There is always going to be a shuttle running in between 9am in the morning and 8pm in the evening. Below is the list of CCC’s daily operating hours.

    Mon-Thu
    7am-8pm
    Fri
    7am-12am
    Sat
    9am-12am
    Sun
    9am-8pm
  • Notice

    Stop Closures

    The following stops are temporarily closed. Last updated on Nov 5th, 2020.

    Purple Route Banner Route
    • 303 | Redwood Street
    • 316 | 33rd St-Medstar Union Memorial
    • 330 | Conway Street
    • 401 | Conway Street

Our Policies

Promises we make

  • No Strand Policy.

    Riders present at any of the Circulator stops at the end of service hours, will be allowed to board and will be taken to their respective stop destinations on the same route. Service will not be provided to riders who arrive at stops after service hours.

  • Layover.

    From time to time during your trip on the Charm City Circulator, you may notice the bus makes an occasional unscheduled stop for a short period. No need to worry! This is what is known as a “Layover” and it’s necessary to maintain headways and keep our operation on-time. Unlike most transit operations, the Charm City Circulator does not utilize timetables to drive schedules and/or arrival times; but rather, we use headways. As such, a layover is necessary to correct the timing of the bus on its specified route; especially if it’s running too fast, to prevent “bunching” of buses. Additionally, it serves as a safety measure to ensure our operators receive enough rest so that they remain as alert as possible while operating the bus.
